verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> <WH8764> upon Shushaneduth <WH7802>, Michtam <WH4387> of David <WH1732>, to teach <WH3925> <WH8763>; when he strove <WH5327> <WH8687> with Aramnaharaim <WH763> <WH5104> and with Aramzobah <WH760>, when Yo'av <WH3097> returned <WH7725> <WH8799>, and smote <WH5221> <WH8686> of Edom <WH123> in the valley <WH1516> of salt <WH4417> twelve <WH8147> <WH6240> thousand <WH505>. O 'Elohim <WH430>, thou hast cast us off <WH2186> <WH8804>, thou hast scattered <WH6555> <WH8804> us, thou hast been displeased <WH599> <WH8804>; O turn thyself to us again <WH7725> <WH8787>.
Thou hast made the earth <WH776> to tremble <WH7493> <WH8689>; thou hast broken <WH6480> <WH8804> it: heal <WH7495> <WH8798> the breaches <WH7667> thereof; for it shaketh <WH4131> <WH8804>.
Thou hast shewed <WH7200> <WH8689> thy people <WH5971> hard things <WH7186>: thou hast made us to drink <WH8248> <WH8689> the wine <WH3196> of astonishment <WH8653>.
Thou hast given <WH5414> <WH8804> a banner <WH5251> to them that fear <WH3373> thee, that it may be displayed <WH5127> <WH8710> because <WH6440> of the truth <WH7189>. Selah <WH5542>.
That thy beloved <WH3039> may be delivered <WH2502> <WH8735>; save <WH3467> <WH8685> with thy right hand <WH3225>, and hear <WH6030> <WH8798> me.

'Elohim <WH430> hath spoken <WH1696> <WH8765> in his holiness <WH6944>; I will rejoice <WH5937> <WH8799>, I will divide <WH2505> <WH8762> SH'khem <WH7927>, and mete out <WH4058> <WH8762> the valley <WH6010> of Sukkot <WH5523>.
Gil`ad <WH1568> is mine, and M'nasheh <WH4519> is mine; Efrayim <WH669> also is the strength <WH4581> of mine head <WH7218>; Y'hudah <WH3063> is my Torahgiver <WH2710> <WH8781>;
Moab <WH4124> is my washpot <WH5518> <WH7366>; over Edom <WH123> will I cast out <WH7993> <WH8686> my shoe <WH5275>: Philistia <WH6429>, triumph <WH7321> <WH8708> thou because of me.
Who will bring <WH2986> <WH8686> me into the strong <WH4692> city <WH5892>? who will lead <WH5148> <WH8804> me into Edom <WH123> ?
Wilt not thou, O 'Elohim <WH430>, which hadst cast us off <WH2186> <WH8804>? and thou, O 'Elohim <WH430>, which didst not go out <WH3318> <WH8799> with our armies <WH6635> ?
Give <WH3051> <WH8798> us help <WH5833> from trouble <WH6862>: for vain <WH7723> is the help <WH8668> of man <WH120>.
Through 'Elohim <WH430> we shall do <WH6213> <WH8799> valiantly <WH2428>: for he it is that shall tread down <WH947> <WH8799> our enemies <WH6862>.
